FullDescriptions:
To apply for the postion, please send cover letter and resume to jobs@borisfx.com with the job title in the subject field.
Software Engineer
Are you someone who would be excited about working in the visual effects industry developing VFX tools for the next blockbuster movie or Super Bowl commercial? Do you have a passion for quality, super-fast, clean code?
Boris FX is a leading provider of specialized visual effects software to the film, media and advertising industries worldwide. Our products are used in top video content of all kinds. We care about speed, quality (both code and image!) and creativity. We’re looking for a motivated engineer to help us move faster, scale larger, and create more amazing products.
You’d work closely with the rest of our small, focused development group on next-generation visual effects software and make a significant impact on our company.
This position is in our Boston, MA office. Salary commensurate with skills and experience.
Roles and Responsibilities
Write cool image-processing effects in C/C++ and CUDA
Create UIs in Python/PyQt.
We all wear many hats, so there’s some customer interaction, bug fixes, conferences, product design, and QA as well as serious high-performance software development.
Required Experience
3-7 years of programming experience.
Solid experience, comfort and fluency with C++.
Experience with parallel or GPU programming.
Image processing and/or computer vision skills.
Experience creating, debugging and shipping high-performance products
CS/Engineering college degree
Familiarity with two or more of Windows, Mac and Linux
Experience with distributed version control (especially git)
Experience with agile development, bug tracking (such as jira)
Pluses
Familiarity with video editing/effects software development
Comfort and fluency with Python.
Strong debugging skills and a desire to solve challenging problems
Personal Characteristics
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Detail oriented
Enthusiasm to learn
Team-oriented
Likes small company environment

Title: Software Engineer Intern
FullDescriptions:
About Brightcove

Brightcove is revolutionizing the way organizations deliver video experiences. We are the industry leader in this space, enabling our customers to deliver professional quality video to audiences on every screen. Our customers range from some of the largest media publishers to corporate marketing departments to large non-profit organizations, spanning the globe. With over 500 employees around the world, we have worked hard to create a company where talented, passionate people can thrive in a culture that values individual empowerment, excellence, and collaboration.

Position Overview

Brightcove is looking for a Software Engineer intern! This is a rare opportunity to be part of an organization that is shaping the future look and feel of interactive media and television. We are seeking candidates who will thrive on working as part of a talented and highly Agile engineering team. You will have the opportunity to work with great engineers on cutting edge technology using leading edge software and development processes. You'll gain exposure to how a real engineering team works, from planning to shipping code. You must be eager to learn, make a difference, and set yourself up for a great career as an engineer.

To learn more about the experience, and see how past Interns enjoyed their time please click here: https://bcove.video/2viYgZt ( https://bcove.video/2viYgZt ).

Job Responsibilities


Participate in all phases of the software lifecycle (defining, planning, developing, implementing, shipping, maintaining).
Work closely with software engineers, product managers, and designers in an Agile engineering organization to help design, build, test, and maintain our digital media deployment products.
Collaborate on the technical design of significant and meaningful new initiatives.
Collaborate with engineers across the company.
Help shape our products by providing input on designs and giving feedback on usability.
Work with the entire product team to validate the quality of our releases.

Skills/Qualifications


Actively pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science or a related field
Javascript coding proficiency preferred (classroom or project experience)
Good knowledge of Internet/Web development and technologies
Good analytical skills with strong problem solving abilities
Prior internship or development/QA experience is highly desirable

Working at Brightcove

As the undisputed global leader in powering premium video for our customers, Brightcove recruits and retains highly qualified and motivated individuals, creating an environment where people can innovate and achieve their best, and we reward them for their performance by giving them the opportunity to share in the company's success.

This role is located in our Boston office which is located downtown, right on Fort Point harbor. The office has an open yet focused working space layout with beautiful water views. Employees enjoy access to fully-stocked kitchens and social activities including: happy hours, trivia and movie nights, ping pong tournaments, and philanthropy events. We celebrate a variety of personal interests with organized groups and clubs including Debate Club, Women of Brightcove, Women in Engineering, Philanthropy Committee, Brightcove Bake Club, and many more!

If you've gotten all the way to the bottom of this description, thank you for your interest in Brightcove! If this role sounds like something that is exciting to you please don't hesitate to apply, even if you don't meet all of our qualifications. We recognize that no candidate is perfect and Brightcove would love to have the chance to get to know you.

Title: Software Engineer
FullDescriptions:
InsightSquared is the leading sales and marketing analytics provider for growing companies that want to run their business by the numbers. We help our customers make better decisions by equipping them with actionable, real-time intelligence that drives predictable growth.

We're funded by a great team of investors including Accomplice, Tola Capital, DFJ, Bessemer, and Salesforce.com.
We were named a leader in the G2 Crowd’s Business Intelligence Platform Grid℠, ranking #1 in customer satisfaction for the fourth year in a row.
We are a four-time winners of The Boston Business Journal’s “Best Places to Work” and The Boston Globe’s “Top Places to Work.”

InsightSquared is looking for a Software Engineer to help shape the growth of our sales and marketing analytics platform. Be part of a close-knit engineering team that utilizes modern technologies and Agile development methods to create robust products serving near real-time business metrics to 20,000+ users around the world.

If you want to join a team of motivated engineers and solve real-world technical challenges to help our customers build successful businesses, InsightSquared is the place for you!

At InsightSquared, you'll...

Work on an autonomous Scrum team in an exciting, collaborative environment focused on building high-value, reliable, and scalable SaaS products
Design and develop full-stack solutions to technical challenges, including: * Web application development in Python and Django and React single page app
Frontend UI/UX in JS/React/CSS
Extract Transform Load (ETL) pipeline in Python
Backend REST APIs in Django and AWS
Micro-services architecture with AWS Lambdas and Docker
Continuous integration/deployment with AWS Codebuild
Mentor teammates to help them learn and grow as a technologists and collaborators
Collaborative code review process
Ship code on your first day, and every day

We're looking for…

2+ years experience developing full-stack web applications
Excellent knowledge of software engineering, computer science, and distributed systems
Extensive experience building and maintaining back-end application infrastructures, including debugging and performance tuning; Python expertise is a plus
Experience with modern front-end frameworks (e.g. React, Angular, etc.) and front-end build pipeline tools
Experience with Git or other version control systems
Interest in AWS, GCP, or similar cloud computing platforms
Self motivation, openness to mentorship, and direct contributions to a team
Excellent written, verbal and gif-based communication skills
Positive energy to bring to your team and environment
A passion for hops, barley and malt

FullDescriptions:
About this Opportunity

Builds application components, tests and deploys code. Has awareness of data security, retention, and recovery issues. Can research technologies independently. Develops knowledge of application components, vendor products, program languages, databases, operating systems, etc. Executes on the plan by building components, testing, and deploying solutions.

The DTCC ADM Associate Software Engineer (ASE) is developing specific technical knowledge in order to assist in the construction of critical system components. The ASE works as part of an ADM project team under the supervision of the more senior technical contributors. The ASE will work as part of a team to implement solutions using appropriate software patterns and coding standards. Candidates in this position are developing expertise on specific program languages, vendor products, DTCC applications, data structures, and/or business lines. This means gaining experience through exposure to: solution design, working as part of a development team, testing, troubleshooting, and production support. The ASE must possess good communication skills and be a tenacious learner.
Implement intuitive, maintainable, responsive web application UI’s using JavaScript technologies.
Build reusable code and libraries for future use.
Build and support Angular web applications.
Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.
Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.
Build appropriate unit, integration and/or automated testing solutions.
Collaborate with the backend team to define the API specification.
sting, and deploying solutions.

The DTCC ADM Associate Software Engineer (ASE) is developing specific technical knowledge in order to assist in the construction of critical system components. The ASE works as part of an ADM project team under the supervision of the more senior technical contributors. The ASE will work as part of a team to implement solutions using appropriate software patterns and coding standards. Candidates in this position are developing expertise on specific program languages, vendor products, DTCC applications, data structures, and/or business lines. This means gaining experience through exposure to: solution design, working as part of a development team, testing, troubleshooting, and production support. The ASE must possess good communication skills and be a tenacious learner.

What You'll Do

Technology Expertise –developing subject matter expertise on one or more programming languages such as Java, JavaScript, trouble-shooting and production support, understanding different development methodologies (waterfall, agile, etc.), vendor products, DTCC applications, data structures, business lines,
System Performance –will have an understanding of code patterns and design that meets performance requirements

Sound Like You?

Who We Are
With over 40 years of experience, DTCC is the premier post-trade market infrastructure for the global financial services industry. From operating facilities and data centers around the world, DTCC automates, centralizes, and standardizes the processing of financial transactions across the trade lifecycle and mitigates risk for thousands of institutions worldwide. At DTCC we value on our clients' interests and partner to deliver superior results with excellence and innovation and lead with integrity. We proactively develop your potential and invest in your career.

Title: Software Engineer - Video Data Infrastructure
Requirement:
3+ years of backend development experience.
A strong technical background with experience building backend services with a server-side technology such as Java, Scala, Thrift, or Node.js.
A proven understanding of storage and caching systems, interface and API design, and the ability to use and apply them in real-world situations with complex constraints
Experience working closely across a variety of teams including other backend engineers, front end engineers, and product management
Knowledge of core CS concepts such as common data structures and algorithms, profiling/optimization
FullDescriptions:
Who We Are

The Video Data Infrastructure builds stream and aggregation infrastructure that makes it easy to measure and understand the performance of video at Twitter’s scale. We collect tens of billions of daily video events from hundreds of millions of Twitter users. In order to do this, we work on cutting edge streaming compute technologies. The correct collection, aggregation, and serving of video analytics data are critical to being able to meet the strategic needs of Twitter both now and in the future.
﻿
Our video data empowers data scientists to gain insights into how our users are consuming video related content and answer important questions in support of data-driven business decisions, it drives externally visible video view video analysis in Twitter products, and it allows product teams to build and measure what they want quickly and easily. We focus heavily on our customers to make sure we’re building the best products to multiply the impact of others at Twitter. We’re a team of highly-skilled, collaborative, enthusiastic and passionate engineers working in this leading-edge space.


What You’ll Do

You’ll help identify and build products that allow developers at Twitter to easily aggregate, measure, and analyze the performance of their products at scale, and end users of Twitter to understand how their media is performing on the platform. We’ll both challenge and support you to do the best work of your career. You’ll have the opportunity to have a truly global impact, working on products that shape and influence the world.


Who You Are

We’re looking for a software engineer who excels at building robust and scalable products in a collaborative and customer focused environment. The ideal candidate should have experience working on backend technologies and as a bonus will have prior experience doing analytics and data aggregation work at scale.

If this sounds like it might be you, you probably have:

A track record of building great products
A strong focus on doing the right thing for your customers
Outstanding communication and collaboration skills
A technical depth that allows you to rapidly diagnose and fix bugs
A dedicated and enthusiastic approach to solving complex problems
A detailed approach to writing tests and quality assurance
Strong quantitative background to support data-informed decision making


Requirements

3+ years of backend development experience.
A strong technical background with experience building backend services with a server-side technology such as Java, Scala, Thrift, or Node.js.
A proven understanding of storage and caching systems, interface and API design, and the ability to use and apply them in real-world situations with complex constraints
Experience working closely across a variety of teams including other backend engineers, front end engineers, and product management
Knowledge of core CS concepts such as common data structures and algorithms, profiling/optimization


We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Twitter. Twitter is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.

FullDescriptions:
18111BR
Software Engineer-Front End Frameworks
Watertown, MA
Job Summary
The Platform organization at Athenahealth is looking for a new member for their Front-End Frameworks team. This team works directly with stakeholders to build out the frameworks necessary to keep our products on the forefront of front-end web technologies. This position involves building out core frameworks and tooling that are required by all other developers within Athena to successfully build their product. But enough about us; let’s talk about you.

You are a software engineer with experience building full stack web applications, preferably in public and private cloud environments. You are a builder at heart and have a passion for building out tools to allow development to happen. You are a problem solver and are always excited to tackle a complex puzzle.

Job Responsibilities

Design and develop code on an agile team of Engineers, a Scrum Master, a Product Owner, and Experience Designer
Collaborate with team members to promote productivity and effectiveness; share business and technical insights with the broader engineering and product organization
Develop knowledge and domain expertise. Take ownership of what you and the team builds and coordinate your efforts across the teams to ensure proper completion
Typical Qualifications
About 2+ years of software engineering experience
Proficient in at least one modern programming language and relational databases
We work in Agile environment, so any Agile experience or CI/CD concepts is helpful
Knowledge of Unix/Linux, RESTful API, and various other technologies is helpful
Experience around general web platform concepts including http, css, cors and caching
Experience with AWS, NodeJS, Webpack is helpful
Experience with React and Typescript is helpful
About athenahealth
Our Purpose: To unleash our collective potential to transform healthcare.
Our Location: This role is based in Watertown, MA, just a few miles outside of Boston. Watertown is our Global Headquarters and our campus, the Arsenal on the Charles, is home to a number of restaurants, a local gym and large outdoor space. This office also has a cafeteria, coffee café and food trucks that rotate every day.
Our Culture: If you’re curious, passionate and waånt to connect with work that matters, you’ve come to the right place. At athenahealth, our employees (or “athenistas”) are committed to making healthcare smarter. At the heart of athenahealth's culture is unconditional positive regard for one another, our customers, their patients and our community. We take time to celebrate diversity and our accomplishments and strive to be powerfully relevant and refreshingly candid in everything we do.
Our Perks: Along with health & financial benefits, our athenistas are offered a variety of perks that promote employee wellbeing such as commuter support (We were named one of the 2018 Best Workplaces for Commuters!), collaborative workspaces and dog-friendly offices - just to name a few.

Title: Software Engineer
FullDescriptions:
Working at MIT offers opportunities, an environment, a culture – and benefits – that just aren’t found together anywhere else. If you’re curious, motivated, want to be part of a unique community, and help shape the future – then take a look at this opportunity.

SOFTWARE ENGINEER, Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL), to help lead software development efforts for research on Human Support Robots (HSR) conducted under projects of the Toyota-CSAIL Joint Research Center. The center aims to advance the science and technologies that enable a future where robots can work safely and seamlessly with and around humans. Will work on the development and integration of cutting-edge algorithmic robotics research, primarily on a Toyota HSR platform; collaborate with MIT principal investigators leading the research to conduct proposed research experiments and build capabilities for real-world human support scenarios; and both lead the overall software architectural design and the implementation, deployment, and maintenance of the full software stack.

Job Requirements
REQUIRED: bachelor’s degree (advanced degree preferred) in computer science, robotics, engineering, or related field; one year of robot navigation algorithm development experience involving deployment of perception, planning, and control algorithms on robotic platforms; professional experience with design methodologies, design patterns, and architecture of large and complex software systems; knowledge of modern software development practices (continuous integration, style guides, code reviews) and tools (e.g., Git, CMake, Jenkins); proficiency with C++ and Python; solid understanding of object-oriented design, data structures, and language constructs; knowledge of Linux and development on Linux systems; experience with ROS (Robot Operating System); excellent project-management, analytical, problem-solving, interpersonal, relationship-management, and verbal and written communication and presentation skills; ability to communicate collaboratively at the highest technical levels with vendors, partners, and all levels of MIT staff; discretion and judgment with confidential information/issues; and ability to coordinate software development efforts among multiple technical members and launch and deliver IT projects on time and within budget. Job #17595
